definition: to conceal/to hide away/to harbor/to store/to collect
flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful

sentences.english: This herb is also pretty common to most people as Safflower.
sentences.chinese: 这种草药也被许多人称为藏红花Safflower。

sentences.english: The results indicated that crocin of gardenia fruits is a a main effect on color of pigment formed.
sentences.chinese: 京尼平甙和藏红花素是栀子中的两种主要化学成分。

sentences.english: Nuts Crashed Roasted Salmon Fillet, Saffron Risotto, Capper Sauce.
sentences.chinese: 坚果碎烤三文鱼柳，藏红花烩饭，刺山柑汁。

sentences.english: Commonly known as Safflower, this herb is used to move blood.
sentences.chinese: 众所周知比如藏红花，就是用于促进血液流通。

sentences.english: The crocus come out late this year because of the cold weather.
sentences.chinese: 因为天气寒冷，今年藏红花开得晚。

sentences.english: However, farmers need initial government support to buy saffron bulbs.
sentences.chinese: 然而，农民们需要政府最初的资助来购买藏红花茎。

sentences.english: Red Rice with Prawns, Zucchini, Tomatoes and Saffron.
sentences.chinese: 意大利红米配大虾，节瓜，番茄和藏红花。

sentences.english: Autumn crocuses star the grass under the tree.
sentences.chinese: 秋天的藏红花点缀着树下的草地。

sentences.english: The special zest of this soup is due to the saffron.
sentences.chinese: 这个汤的特殊香味是因为藏红花粉。

sentences.english: The wind whistled through the twigs and fretted the occasional, dirty-looking crocuses.
sentences.chinese: 寒风穿过枯枝，有时把发脏的藏红花吹刮跑了。

sentences.english: There was not a bud anywhere except a few crocuses.
sentences.chinese: 到处都没有新芽，只有一些藏红花。

sentences.english: The palms of his feet and hands were yellow with saffron.
sentences.chinese: 手足的掌心则用藏红花染做了黄色。

sentences.english: Mr Linton had put on her pillow, in the morning, a handful of golden crocuses;
sentences.chinese: 早上，林惇先生在她枕上放一束金色的藏红花。

definition: see 冬蟲夏草|冬虫夏草[dong1 chong2 xia4 cao3]
donkey-hide gelatin (used in TCM)/Taiwan pr. [a1 jiao1]
Epimedium, genus of herbaceous flowering plant, cultivated in the Far East as aphrodisiac/also called barrenwort or horny goatweed (said to resemble crushed goat's testicles)
